ACT
183
Minutes and notes
As a rule, minutes are drawn up about the actions taken in the procedure.
Regarding less important statements of the parties and information collected by the court, only a note can be placed on the file instead of the minutes.
The minutes are signed by the parties if they were present at the action in the procedure, the judge or court advisor who drew up the minutes, and the recorder.
The note on the file is signed by the person who drew it up.
